comments:
Column properties should be disabled when no column is selected or available.  Currently if you type into or change a column property for a non-existent attribute override you will get the following exceptions:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.ColumnComposite.columnComboModified(ColumnComposite.java:181)
	at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.ColumnComposite$1.modifyText(ColumnComposite.java:158)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:928)

OR

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.ColumnComposite.insertableSelectionChanged(ColumnComposite.java:233)
at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.ColumnComposite$3.selectionChanged(ColumnComposite.java:224)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer$2.run(Viewer.java:162)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:843)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.JFaceUtil$1.run(JFaceUtil.java:44)
at org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable.run(SafeRunnable.java:149)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer.fireSelectionChanged(Viewer.java:160)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.updateSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1976)
